messages.content: “Uh, he got spirited away? By a guy. Yeah.”

"What?" Ruth.

"The uh- The leader of the Hellhound's assassins, apparently." Orion attempts to look innocent.
Nash shrugs.

"That could be a problem." Ruth ponders this before wiping her lips. "Which one of you...?"

"I-It was Nash!" Orion panics.
“Are you stupid?!?” Nash yells. “An idiot! You’re an idiot!” He kicks Orion. “That was *yoooooour* stupid idea, that *youuuuuuu* initiated, and now you’re dragging me in with your b-bullshit…”

Ruth approaches both of them with a serious expression. 

Orion is sweating.

"You both need better training, clearly. CPR is if you find someone drowned. That's not why I was down, evidently. Think things through." She bonks both of you on the head.

*Oh fuck. We got away with it.*

A quick, cruel wave of shame-power-relief-terror washes over him. An inevitable knee-jerk reaction. They got away with it. They could get away with anything, if they wanted. And they *should* want.

Does she know, deep down? Is she deflecting for their sake? For the same reasons they’d be deflecting? Because it’s the natural order of things, and you’re j-just not allowed to draw attention to it? That must be it. Everybody knows. Everybody in this whole rotten world can just tell - what it’s supposed to be like, what the balance between men and women is supposed to equalize to. And they survive knowing this. They navigate every single day knowing this. They don’t go insane. They don’t collapse under the weight of it all. Somehow, they don’t fall apart.

Alright. Alright.

“I mean, there was a lot of water!” Nash protests, doing his best to sound nonchalant as he grips his head. “Ow-ow-ow…” A parody. A pantomime of something. The three of them acting out the same comedy routine, where she hits them and they react, always reacting.

A faint smile appears on her face as Nash confirms this idea. She walks towards the door, immediately changing the subject. "So we know the hellhounds were responsible now. They must be allied with Asturian, then." 

"O-Oh, yeah..." Orion mouths 'sorry' to Nash.

Nash flips him off behind Ruth’s back.

“Yes.” He says to her.

"Which means if anyone knows where they've gone, it'll be him." Ruth rushes out of the room.

"Holy shit dude... Is she actually that stupid?" Orion whispers.
“Shut the fuck up!” Nash turns on him, harshly whispering. “Don’t insult her! We already- We already-!” He can’t put it into words. He’s shaking all over.

"Did you fall in love or something? Dude that's so cheesy..." Orion snickers.

"Hurry up." Ruth calls out.

“No!” Nash yell-whispers. “Don’t be stupid, you - *ugh!*”

He rushes after her.

Orion follows. 

Ruth heads back towards the castle.
Nash follows.

Guards surround them as they enter.

Ruth gets into a weak fighting stance. "What now?"
Nash also instinctively assumes a fighting stance.
An unfortunate face takes a step toward them. "Well, well, well... If it isn't the villainous traitors to our empire."
“What? Shut up.”

"We arrested you. How are you free?" Ruth.

"Well... The guards went to see the general about these accusations. And unfortunately for you... He's dead. Just your words against mine, now. You don't have the authority to do anything but stand there and suffer for your hubris." Asturian.
((sry give me like 15 min))
“Our *hubris*? Are you serious??”

"Deadly serious. Guards, lock them up!" Asturian.

"Run!" Ruth grabs the hands of Nash and Orion and forcefully takes off in the opposite direction of Asturian.
“Shit!” Nash yells, and takes off in a sprint alongside them.
((Roll acrobatics or athletics))

You successfully evade the guards and end up in some random alleyway. "Shit..." Ruth grimaces.

"Well, we can't go back now..." Orion.
Nash bites down on his lip very hard and doesn’t say anything.

"They'll check the inns as well. We'll sleep here in shifts. I'll take the first shift, so you 2 can go rest up from your long day of being useless." Ruth.

Orion looks like he's about to protest but instead just lays on the floor and tries to sleep.

Nash doesn’t say anything. He just looks at Ruth for a second.

He wants to say something. Anything. *I’m sorry,* or *there’s something really wrong with me,* or *you deserved it.* But he can’t. The words are like ash in his throat.

He sits on the ground. He tries to sleep.
Nash wakes up after what is essentially a full rest. Orion is shaking him awake. "Your turn, Nash."
“Right.” He says, yawning. He stares out emptily into the alleyway.
Orion goes to sleep. Nash is alone with their unconscious bodies.

He’s so tired. He just slept for hours, so it’s a ridiculous thing for him to be, objectively, but - he’s so tired. He feels like his entire body’s been dragged through a pit of gravel. He can’t stop thinking about it.

Her on the ground. Unconscious. Near-dead as he, what, kissed her? Because he’s sick? Because he’s insane?

He thinks about Oswalda, too. Her serenity as she explained just how women exercised their power over men, the hand on the reins. He doesn’t want to think about it. When he thinks about it he feels terrified, panicked, the blood in his body thrumming with fear. And that in itself is an admission, isn’t it? That he’s the sort of man that won’t ever be happy or comfortable taking up his rightful position in the world his mothers want to build. *Beneath* them. 

But at the same time, they’re different creatures, right? Ontologically distinct. Like two diametrically opposing magnets. They can’t touch. No synthesis can ever be reached. So even the tension he feels - the push and pull - becomes naturalized, calcified, an inevitable fact of reality. Women exercise their power. Men grapple with that power. Negotiate with it. Grasp at the dangling strings. Whatever leverage they… he can get…

He’s still so scared. He doesn’t understand it, that fear. He doesn’t understand it at all. What are these limp empty bodies *doing* to him? They’re just sleeping. They’re just people… sleeping. Helpless. Quiet. So far away from any demonstrations of anything, of control, of…
He glances at Orion’s form again. Is he… properly sleeping?
He is.
Nash inches closer to him. And just.. examines his face, for a second.

He looks different, when he’s sleeping. His lashes are, like, long. His hair settles against his face. His breaths come out slow and steady, instead of the normal half-panicked neuroticism Nash has come to expect from him.

His face looks soft. But in a different way than Ruth’s? Somehow? He doesn’t understand the difference. But there is one, and it’s important. He knows, somehow, that it’s important.
His hand twitches forwards. An instinctive movement, one that happens without his consent or even awareness. Like it’s natural.
Nash grabs his own wrist. What the fuck is he doing?

His eyes flicker to Orion’s mouth, for a second. Then he covers his face with his hands and, very quietly, screams uncontrollably into his own clasped arms. 

Quietly. Not loudly enough to wake anyone. Obviously.
*What is wrong with you!* *What is wrong with you!* *What is wrong with you!*

*God, was it not enough to… to do that to Ruth in her sleep? Do you have to fall prey to the exact same terrible misstep again?? You won’t GET AWAY with it this time if you try, idiot. There’s no excuse of CPR. There’s no excuse of.. of what she deserves, or what the two of you are owed, or what power she’s brandishing by existing, her hands on the leash that you’re rightfully taking back. This would just be.. it would just be… there wouldn’t be a reason for it! You wouldn’t be upholding anything! Not servitude to a Goddess, not reaffirmation of duty! You’d just be sick! You’d be ffffucking insane! And everyone would know it!!*
*He’s the worst person ever! He might be your only friend, but he’s also the worst person ever! Stop being pathetic! Stop flaying yourself open for someone who doesn’t fucking care!*

He wants it so badly. Holy fuck. He wants it so badly. Just to know. To know what it would be like! To..

He wants to set himself on *fire.* Holy shit. He wants it so badly. Fuck. Fuck. Fuck. This is the worst thing in the entire world. Maybe the worst thing that’s ever happened to anyone? 

He wants to *set himself on fire.*
Nash remains entirely still for the remainder of the shift. He doesn’t look at Orion even once. His face stays fixed on the horizon.
Someone should really put him down.
You start to hallucinate something. At least you must be hallucinating. How else would the duchess be here, appearing before you? She walks towards you with a confident expression.
“What..?” Nash mumbles, confused. “Mo…ther?”
"Good morning, Nash. Are you ready to save the empire?" She smirks.
“Yes.” He says immediately. “Yes, obviously. Are you… really here?”

"Of course, Nash." She bends forward to be face to face with him. "I need you to teach the Hellhounds a bit of a lesson before I can complete my plans, however. Once I leave, get those 2 to head to the abandoned coliseum where Oswalda used to work. Do you know where that is, Nash?"
“Um, no. Where?”
She provides direction. "It’s not accessible normally. But there’s a magically concealed entrance. Just be sure to be stealthy." She provides additional directions for identifying the fake wall.
"Alright." Nash says, nodding. "What will we do there?"
"Kill as many as you can. That traitor Washington will be there too."
Nash swallows. Nods. "Alright."
He pauses for a second.
"How do I... I mean, what should I say to them?" He gestures to Orion and Ruth.
"Whatever you say, do it quick. You’ll miss your window, otherwise." She pats him on the head condescendingly.
"Mom, I..." He struggles for the correct words. "Did you hear about what happened? Back home?"
"To some degree. Why?"
"I just." He swallows again, almost compulsively. "Wanted to let you know. That everyone is okay. That I protected them."
"Good job. Are you asking for some kind of reward?" She seems amused.
"No! I mean, I would never demand anything of you, mother. I just. Wanted to make sure you, knew..." He looks down, shamed.
*Reward me. Reward me, please. Tell me I've done good.*
"You won’t get anything without asking for it, Nash." She starts to leave.
"Wait!"
He calls out.
"Hm?"
"I. I do want a reward, actually. I protected everyone, and maintained your.. the family's dignity."
"Hm? And what is it?"
He pauses. "Whatever you see fit to give me...?"
She approaches him slowly with a cold expression.
He waits.
She kisses Nash’s forehead. "That’s the reward for pleasing the duchess. Though usually I don’t do it like a mother. You can consider that special to you, if you want."
Nash nods, throat suddenly dry. "Th-thank you."
She walks away silently.

Nash just sits for a second, clutching his knees to his chest. He allows himself a second of it - that dizzying fear, comorbid with joy. Acknowledgment. *So why are you scared? So whyyyyy are you scared?*
He doesn't know. He doesn't.. he doesn't know.
In lieu of interrogating himself any further, he instead leans over and shakes Orion awake.
"Huh…? Is it morning?" Orion.
"Listen. I need you to help me convince Ruth of something."
"What? She’s not gonna kiss you again, dude."
"What? N-no! That's not what I'm talking about!"
"Then what?"
"We've got to go to - a place. The abandoned colosseum where my mom used to work. It's an order from my mother."
"What? Why? How would she even-?"
"It's an order! We need to do it, to help - solidify her position. Weed out traitors. It'll keep us safe."
"Uh… Okay, sure. So what do you need my help for?"
"Killing the people there? Obviously."
"I meant with Ruth."
"I figure, if we present a united front, she won't immediately yell no and that we're stupid?"
"I kind of doubt that but okay." He shakes Ruth awake.
Nash waits for her to wake up.

"What?" Ruth.

"Uh, we need to go somewhere." Orion.
"The old colosseum." He says impatiently.

"Why there?" Ruth.

"Uh, you’ll see when we get there?" Orion.
"Yeah."

"Uh, do you know how to get there Nash?" Orion.

"Fine. Just make sure to be stealthy right now. We don’t want guards to notice us." Ruth.
"Yes. My mother told me."
He leads them there.
Stealthily.
((Roll stealth))
They stealth off towards the coliseum. ((End session))
They continue. "What's your plan, exactly? Once we kill Grognaut."

"...Putting aside whether that is even at all possible, I'm not sure. Ideally, I'd like to figure out who the actual killer of the Emperor was, but that still wouldn't help with the current situation. Of course, my plan as a whole still stays to expose the corruption of the Order, but that's more of a grand scheme than a plan."
Selle scratches their head.
"In the end, it'll be about figuring it out as it unfolds. It'd be nice to take control of my own fate here, but recent events have really made a mess of my head. What about you?"
"More travels, I suppose. The right courses of action have a way of finding me."
"That's honorable. You do seem like a mysterious person when it comes to your motives though, I have to wonder why you seem to be so obsessed with Grognaut, but it seems like a sensitive topic."
"Ha." He doesn't elaborate. "What about the acting emperor? Planning to do anything to him?"

*Yeah, I knew he would just brush it off like that. I don't think I'll get anything out of him directly.*
"It already feels like everything will collapse under him without my direct interference, but if push comes to shove, it might be good to do something. As for what... Well, the time will come to decide. As a policy though, I don't kill. I don't want to stoop to his level. He deserves to suffer, so death is too much of an easy way out for him."
"You think emperors suffer?"
"There's ways to make anyone suffer."
"Like what?"

"There's plenty ways to make someone pay for their crimes. Whether it's humane or not is irrelevant, torture is an abundant aspect of human psychology to inflict suffering onto a person. Whether that's psychological or physical. Anyone who's spent a decent amount of times in the backstreets of Soltaria would know. It's a gruesome topic."

"It comes to a point where you think, how many people has this person inflicted ridiculous hours and days and nights of suffering onto? How many lives has he turned into ruin and constant darkness, a complete lack of faith in existence. Giving hope then stealing it all away in just one moment, only to bait people back and forth to keep them stimulated yet to keep the enjoyment of their life to a minimum, having them just barely exist. How much suffering and how widespread is it that this *one man* has inflicted. There's nothing but suffering that awaits him, whether it's in life or the afterlife, if that even exists. Death is simply an escape from justice"
"It's another matter whether or not I am fit to be a judge of his morality, though."
"I see. You're a funny guy." They reach Laura's office.

Selle steps inside. 
Selle shouts into the room as they enter. "Hey, we've got another victim here, are you alright?"

"What happened!?" Laura is still holding the card.

"Don't worry about it." Erik lays down on the couch.
"It's not super important at the moment, just let him rest, it's clear we got into a fight with someone, and got out alive. More importantly, are *you* alright?"
"Yeah. I think he'll make it through." She overly dismissively shrugs. "Just... Just get some rest too."

Selle notices the card.
"You're still handling that card?"
"It's most likely a bomb. Anything I do risks triggering it." Laura.

Selle's eyes widen a bit.
"That fucker. What's his problem?"
Selle shakes their head.
"...I might be able to use Identify on it, but if it's so risky to even do anything to it then I'm not sure if it'll help. I'm not proficient in abjuration, and Donald is a much more proficient sorcerer than me."
"There's no way I'll be able to rest until we figure out how to deal with it."
"I have a plan." Erik speaks up. "Just let me rest and I'll help you get your revenge."

*...Revenge is an oddly specific word for him to use here.*
"Got it. I'll place my trust in you."
Selle sits down.
"Anyway, we met the General. He was *extremely* out of it, but it ended with his death. He just... showed up. Seemed like he was looking for someone."
"The... General? Like Jonald Triden? He's dead?"
"Yeah. We were talking, and he came up to us, just... out of nowhere. He was really incoherent, and seemed to think one of us was the killer of the Emperor, and started attacking us."
"Oh yeah... Doesn't that high priestess think you did it?"
"She seems to be claiming through some sort of divination that it was revealed that I was the killer. But... I think the general knew the *actual* killer."
"How is that possible?"

"The way Erik put it was that the general wouldn't go around tailing someone if he couldn't tell his followers. He seemed to know some extreme secret. It also seemed to be someone who was just here, in the catacombs. And also, you would know, he was already missing for a *while*."
"Well... I don't know... He's just kind of an idiot? Like his brain is full of more holes than cheese is. And he's been around at the castle, I don't know what you mean." Laura.
"He might be an idiot, and the fact he just aggro'd onto us on sight proves that, but that doesn't mean he couldn't have met the culprit while he was missing during the murder."
"He had to have had *some* reason to be just wandering around the catacombs."
"Alright, sure... I'll consider it." She shrugs.

"It doesn't really matter that much anymore, since he's dead. We don't have a lead anymore." 
Selle scratches their head and sighs.
"Well, maybe they'll waste money resurrecting him." She laughs.

"Hah, if they'd even be bothered coming down here to find him."
Selle leans back in the seat, sighs and stares at the ceiling.
*It feels like we're getting nowhere. Our main lead is dead, and we're at imminent threat of dying due to the bomb. It's impossible to relax.*

"Night-night, onii-chan." You have no idea what that word means, but her tone conveys it's clearly some kind of joke at your expense. Maybe a tengokuan word? It doesn't matter. She gets back to her work.

Selle's brow furrows a bit at that... phrase.
*I suppose I'll close my eyes a bit.*
They arrive at the home in question. Aliza knocks at the door. "Hello? Is Mr Skylar home?"
I do not answer this question because it is not directed at me.
The man in question opens the door, looking irritated as usual. "Hello? What do you want?"

I forget what we were doing.


……Oh, right. “We’re trying to track down something. Do you know where we’d be able to access detailed floor plans for the city layout?”
"Perhaps I'd have some if you'd bothered to save me." He grumbles angrily.
“What.”
"How could you forget? They had me by the throat and you passed out like weak garbage!"
“I was hit. You’re fine, anyway. You weren’t the one in serious danger.”

"You're certainly not getting anything now, you ungrateful shitstain!" He shakes his fist threateningly. It doesn't work because he's very clearly not a fighter.

"Look, sir... I got captured to protect you. Can you at least give it to me?" Aliza.
“Ungrateful?? Mmmmbrghhrghg.” I mumble before moving away from the doorway a bit and pacing back and forth.

"I'll consider it if that idiot baron over there apologizes for all he's done to me over the years! Corrupting my daughter, getting me involved in some hostage situation, the terrible quality of this poor excuse for a barony-!" He keeps rambling until interrupted.

“Okay, so first of all, there’s no sense in which I corrupted your daughter, we like, barely know each other, essentially. And the root of the hostage situation seems to have been Washington’s scheming, in some form.”

"You can't help yourself, can you you lifeless turd!!!! Always with the excuses, the lies!" Maxwell.

"Ally, just humour him..." Aliza.

“Well, I’m sorry that my policies have made accumulating wealth more difficult for you. And, erm, I can try not to interact with your daughter whenever possible. It’s… probably best for me that that’s the case, also.” 

This is exceedingly difficult. “As for the hostage situation. I have no power over those forces. Which is a problem, certainly. That is… an area in which improvement is imminently required. Addressing criminal elements. It’s what I’m trying to do *right now*. So if you want to deny facilitating this, Maxwell, that’s fine. I’ll just go back to the man in the ivory tower you loathe.”
"Fine." He goes into his house and returns with a layout of the city.
“…Thank you.” The words feel as acid against my throat.
Aliza grabs it and lays it down on the ground, tracing her finger silently from where she was kidnapped to an unclear location.
I let her figure out whatever she’s figuring out.
She circles a vague area. "I think it was around here." There are several buildings here, but one of them stands out most of all: The abandoned coliseum.
“That seems promising.” I point to the large abandoned structure.
"Let's check it out." She rushes in that direction.
I follow.
They arrive at the coliseum. The entrance is covered up by rubble. She puts her hand to the wall and circles around it.
I also check the perimeter for any suspicious areas or possible ways in.
((Roll investigation))
You do not see anything. Aliza's hand enters the wall suddenly. "Here! It's an illusion."
“Oh, good catch.” Right. Magic, of course.
She steps through it, disappearing.
I quickly head in as well.

The air immediately changes. Not in a literal way, but the ambience is clearly different. This lair is clearly the right place. You would be able to tell from the decor, even without the several masked men who quickly encircle you with weapons. They look like Frank's minions.
“Right, I was just thinking this might actually be a bad idea.”

"Where is my father?" Aliza.

A woman in a black dress with a large black hat and veil covering her features enters. "Tsk, tsk..." She shakes her finger disapprovingly. "You're not supposed to be here, Alia." It's a familiar voice.

"That's who I spoke to. The Queen of the Night." Aliza.
“Fascinating. Are you going to kill me? If that’s the case, I’d at least like a few things cleared up first.”

She puts her hand up to her face and gives a haughty laugh. "You're always so funny, Alia."

"Uh... What?" Aliza.
“…Should I refrain from saying your name? I’d probably be wise to make no more trouble than needed.”
With a snap of the Queen's fingers, Aliza falls unconscious. "Well, there's no reason to be subtle now, is there? I was waiting to see if you'd ever figure it out. This also feels like cheating, no?"

“What. How did you do that?” I kneel by her side. “I also don’t exactly think there was much to figure out when you entered my periphery as a person who exists essentially, yesterday. The shadow queen or whatever, obviously. Not Lydia.”

"Perhaps I'm better at this then I realize, then." She laughs. "Unfortunately, you're early for once. The devil of soltaria doesn't like to be bothered before his big shows." With another snap of her fingers, you fall asleep.

You wake up the next morning in a cell of some kind with Aliza. One of Jameson's men is guarding the cell door. 

((End session))
